alert.note: Alert for Cooper; Henry; Johnson; Pettis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 01 at 1:58AM CDT until June 01 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill MO has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Cooper County in central Missouri... Southern Pettis County in central Missouri... Northeastern Henry County in west central Missouri... Southeastern Johnson MO County in west central Missouri... * Until 800 AM CDT Wednesday. * At 158 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Radar estimates between 1.5 to 3 inches has fallen in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sedalia, Clinton, Windsor, Smithton, Leeton, Green Ridge, Calhoun, Otterville, Prairie Home and Post Oak. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
